Description: Green glazed composition shabti figure of an official named Psamtek, son of Tahetjret. Only the upper part is preserved, all the lower section being modern restoration in wood. The figure is shown with a striated wig and false beard. The arms are crossed, holding a hoe in the left hand. Another tool held in the right hand has been broken away, together with part of the left shoulder. Over the shoulder is a basket in relief. Parts of four horizontal lines of hieroglyphic inscription remain.
Acquisition notes: Aquila Dodgson collection donated by Sarah Dodgson in 1951 to E. Raymond Hepper and bequeathed to Nigel Hepper in 1970.
